ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of progressive bilateral loss over 20 years; audiometry confirms symmetrical severe-to-profound SNHL with poor word recognition.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometric testing reveals a symmetrical severe sensorineural hearing loss from 250-2000 Hz, sloping to profound from 3000-8000 Hz. Speech audiometry shows SRTs in agreement with PTAs, but word recognition is poor to very poor (54% AD, 48% AS), indicating significant distortion. Immittance testing is normal (Type A tympanograms) with absent acoustic reflexes, consistent with the severity of the hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe SNHL (250-2000 Hz) sloping to profound (3000-8000 Hz), PTA 83 dB HL. Left ear: Severe SNHL (250-2000 Hz) sloping to profound (3000-8000 Hz), PTA 80 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 75 dB HL, WRS 54%. Left SRT 75 dB HL, WRS 48%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes from 500 to 4000 Hz bilaterally.

counseling_actions: Discuss the severe-to-profound nature of the hearing loss.
Explain that poor word recognition scores limit the benefit of traditional hearing aids.
Counsel on cochlear implantation as a potential option for better speech understanding.

escalation.destination: ENT specialist for cochlear implant consideration
escalation.rationale_short: Patient has poor word recognition and severe-to-profound loss, making him a candidate for cochlear implantation.

expected_outcome: Patient was found to be a surgical candidate for a cochlear implant.
Patient was referred for a formal cochlear implant evaluation.
